DICE Firmware Compiled on 8 Oct 2009
Main Page | Modules | Alphabetical List | Data Structures | Data Fields | Related Pages

Stream Control
[AV System (AVS)]

Detailed Description

Provides control of AVS streaming, channels, formats, and sample rates.


Functions

HRESULT avsGetCh (uint32 plugID, BOOL bTx, uint8 *channel)
 Obtain the current isochronous channel of a plug.
HRESULT avsGetDBS (uint32 plugID, BOOL bTx, uint32 *channels)
 Get number of audio channels for a given plug.

Function Documentation

HRESULT avsStart (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx
) 
 

Start streaming on a plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug. (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4)
bTx True if a Tx plug.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsStartTx (  uint32  plugID  ) 
 

Start streaming on a Tx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 or 2).
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsStartRx (  uint32  plugID  ) 
 

Start streaming on a plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4).
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

BOOL  bTx
) 
 

Stop streaming on a plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug. (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4)
bTx True if a Tx plug.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

Stop streaming on a Tx plug.

Parameters:

Returns:
NO_ERROR(0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsStopRx (  uint32  plugID  ) 
 

Stop streaming on a plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4).
Returns:
NO_ERROR(0) or an error code.

BOOL avsIsStarted (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx
) 
 

Query if a plug is streaming.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug. (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4)
bTx True if a Tx plug.
Returns:
True is the plug is streaming.

BOOL avsIsTxStarted (  uint32  plugID  ) 
 

Query if a Tx plug is streaming.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 or 2).
Returns:
True is the plug is streaming.

BOOL avsIsRxStarted (  uint32  plugID  ) 
 

Query if a Rx plug is streaming.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4).
Returns:
True is the plug is streaming.

HRESULT avsSetCh (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx,
uint8  channel
) 
 

Set the isochronous channel of a plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug. (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4)
bTx True if a Tx plug.
channel The isochronous channel to use.
Returns:
NO_ERROR(0) or an error code.

uint8  channel
) 
 

Set the isochronous channel of a Tx plug.

channel The isochronous channel to use.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetRxCh (  uint32  plugID,
uint8  channel
) 
 

Set the isochronous channel of a Rx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4).
channel The isochronous channel to use.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsGetCh (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx,
uint8 *  channel
) 
 

Obtain the current isochronous channel of a plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug. (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4)
bTx True if a Tx plug.
channel The address to place the current channel.
Returns:
NO_ERROR(0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsGetTxCh (  uint32  plugID,
uint8 *  channel
) 
 

Obtain the current isochronous channel of a Tx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 or 2).
channel The address to place the current channel.
Returns:
NO_ERROR(0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsGetRxCh (  uint32  plugID,
uint8 *  channel
) 
 

Obtain the current isochronous channel of a Rx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4).
channel The address to place the current channel.
Returns:
NO_ERROR(0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetTxPresntOffset (  uint32  plugID,
uint8  samples,
uint8  phase
) 
 

Adjust the presentation time and phase for a Tx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 or 2).
samples The number of samples to adjust. ( 0 <= samples <= 100).
phase The fine tuning phase to adjust in . (0 <= phase <= 100).
Returns:
NO_ERROR(0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetRxPresntAdjust (  uint32  plugID,
int8  samples,
uint8  phase
) 
 

Adjust the presentation time and phase for a Rx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4).
samples The number of samples to adjust. ( 0 <= samples <= 100).
phase The fine tuning phase to adjust in . (0 <= phase <= 100).
Returns:
NO_ERROR(0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetFormat (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx,
uint32  format
) 
 

Set the format in the CIP1 header for a plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4).
bTx True if a Tx plug.
format The format as defined by IEC 61883.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetTxFormat (  uint32  plugID,
uint32  format
) 
 

Set the format in the CIP1 header for a Tx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 or 2).
format The format as defined by IEC 61883.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetRxFormat (  uint32  plugID,
uint32  format
) 
 

Set the format in the CIP1 header for a Rx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4).
format The format as defined by IEC 61883.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsGetFormat (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx,
uint32 *  format
) 
 

Get the format of the CIP1 header for a plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4).
bTx True if a Tx plug.
format The address to place the format in. Value as defined by IEC 61883.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsGetTxFormat (  uint32  plugID,
uint32 *  format
) 
 

Get the format of the CIP1 header for a Tx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 or 2).
format The address to place the format in. Value as defined by IEC 61883.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsGetRxFormat (  uint32  plugID,
uint32 *  format
) 
 

Get the format of the CIP1 header for a Rx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4).
format The address to place the format in. Value as defined by IEC 61883.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsTxMute (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  muteon
) 
 

Set mute for a Tx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 or 2).
muteon True if the plug is to be muted.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsRxMute (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  muteon
) 
 

Set mute for a Rx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4).
muteon True if plug is to be muted.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetSampleRate (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx,
uint8  sfc
) 
 

Set sample rate for a given plug.

Plug must be restarted after calling this function.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4).
bTx True is a Tx plug.
sfc The same frequency code. See AVS_SFC.. definitions in avsDefs.h.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetDBS (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx,
uint32  channels
) 
 

Set the data block size (number of audio channels) for a plug.

This is generally used for Tx plugs.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4).
bTx True if a Tx plug.
channels The number of data blocks, or channels, to use.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsGetDBS (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx,
uint32 *  channels
) 
 

Get number of audio channels for a given plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4).
bTx True is a Tx plug.
channels The address to place the data block size, or number of channels, into.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetTxSpeed (  uint32  plugID,
uint32  speed
) 
 

Set the transmit speed for a Tx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 or 2).
speed The speed to use. Use SPEED_400, SPEED_200, or SPEED_100 defined in 1394.h
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsGetTxSpeed (  uint32  plugID,
uint32 *  speed
) 
 

Obtain the current transmit speed for a Tx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 or 2)
speed The address to place the current speed in. Will be SPEED_400, SPEED_200, or SPEED_100 as defined in 1394.h
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetRxQSelSlot (  uint32  plugID,
uint8  slot,
uint8  value
) 
 

Set the quadlet selection field (the sequence) for a given audio channel on a Rx plug.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (1 to 4)
slot The receive slot (1 to 16)
value The sequence to extract. Must be less than the DBS.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT avsSetOnline (  uint32  plugID,
BOOL  bTx,
BOOL  online
) 
 

Set plug on-line or off-line.

An offline plug will be muted.

Parameters:
plugID The ID of the plug (Tx: 1-2, Rx: 1-4).
bTx True is a Tx plug.
online True if plug is online. False to mute plug.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.
